features: YUM-V's Multivitamin plus Multimineral Formula for Kids (60 count). Milk chocolate bears contain essential vitamins and minerals for children's nutrition and health.

Dietary Supplement: Vitamins and minerals are an essential component in the growth and health of our children. Yum-V's chocolate flavored bears are an excellent way for kids to get their daily vitamin supplements in an easy and tasty manner. Each serving contains 17 vitamins and minerals including 10001U of Vitamin D, Vitamins B 12, B6, E, C, A and K, Zinc and Magnesium.

Features: We believe in using high-quality, natural ingredients for all of our products, and maintain a nut-free production facility. Formula is vegetarian, non-GMO, gluten-free, gelatin free, and contains no artificial colors, flavors or preservatives. Kosher/Halal.

Flavor: Mouthwatering and delicious milk chocolate flavored bears packed with nutritional value. (No refrigeration necessary.) If the chocolate bears melt, simply leave the sealed blister in room temperature for one hour and the bears will regain their form and texture.

Recommended Use: Our top-rated chocolate bears are the very best way to incorporate vitamins and minerals into our kids' diets. Designed for children of all ages, from toddler to teen. Give two of these treats to your kids every day to support their health in a fun and yummy way.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: EVERYTHING IS BETTER WITH CHOCOLATE Everything is better with Chocolate. Chocolate is better with vitamins. That’s a core principle of our delicious and highly nutritious individually packaged chocolate bear multivitamin for kids. They’re so good you won’t have to remind, beg or force your child to get 16 essential vitamins and minerals. They’ll love this melt in your mouth treat as part of their morning health routine.

BENEFITS & FEATURES 16 Essential Vitamins & MineralsMelt in Your Mouth - Won’t Stick to TeethVision SupportImmune System SupportHealthy EnergyGood for Growing Bones60 Count - 2 Month SupplyPop Out Tray - No Giant Hunk of Melted Chocolate!

DENTIST RECOMMENDED Fruit gummy multivitamins are loaded with sugar and pectin that can stick to your teeth and gums. This can cause oral hygiene issues and accelerate tooth decay in child and adult teeth alike. Our proprietary slow cook chocolate method is different and ensures a smooth even dissolve while each chocolate bear melts in your mouth.

Multi Vitamin Calcium + Vitamin D Probiotic Sugar Free Probiotic Count Size 60 Bears 40 Bears 40 Bears 40 Bears Format Milk Chocolate White Milk Chocolate White Milk Chocolate Milk Chocolate Serving Size 1 Bear 1 Bear 1 Bear 1 Bear Gluten Free ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Non GMO Certified ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Sugar Free ✓

BETTER THAN GUMMIES! Chocolate has natural antioxidants in every serving and less sugar than candy style gummy supplements. Prehistoric gummy formulations are old news and regularly clump together into a giant mass of fruit pectin and fillers. Give your kids a wonderful boost with Yum Vs milk chocolate vitamins today!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Finally found a good toddler vitamin!
reviews.reviewText: I have an extremely stubborn and picky 3 year old. I used to put the Tropical Oasis liquid multivitamin in her apple juice, but she's been on an anti apple juice kick lately, so I've been scrambling to try to find another vitamin. She drinks Pediasure with regular chocolate milk, but I tried to find an extra vitamin she'd take, with not much luck. I crushed Flintstones vitamins with a pill crusher, but if there were any bits that didn't dissolve, it'd be all over. I tried the First Day gummies, she wouldn't touch. Stumbled across these, and since she's a chocoholic, I decided to give it a shot. Whaddya know?? These actually do taste like regular chocolate (the kind you'd use for melting and dipping foods in). No aftertaste, just a bit chewy, but no more chewy than a Hershey's kiss, really. And these are so much cheaper than the First Day or Tropical Oasis!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Tastes like chocolate
reviews.reviewText: My children have turned their noses up to so many vitamins. They love these. I tried as well, they taste just like chocolate

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My little has a lot going on medically and absolutely refuses vitamins of any kind...until now. I have to hide them so she doesn't go in for more.Game changer! Thank you so much 💓.Mom win 🏆.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Although I thought they were tasty, my picky eater wouldn’t eat them no matter how I tried to hide it she could taste it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 4 year old loves
reviews.reviewText: My daughter wont eat gummies and juice can be a toss up to hide a liquid vitamin. and Forcing a oral syringe into her mouth every day would not be fun. She LOVES chocolate though and these she eats without a problem. She is mildly autistic so a bit pickier than others but these have been great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 7 year old approved!
reviews.reviewText: My son isn't a big vitamin flavor taker but these he loves!! I only give him 1 so it's a lot easier for him to eat and he enjoys the taste. Would definitely recommend!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It's the only vitamin my granddaughter will eat! Thank you!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars No for our family
reviews.reviewText: My son hated this chocolate (and he is ADDICTED to chocolate) and when I tried it I could tell why that was the case! It’s “waxy” and literally feels like your biting on a crayon. The taste it’s not the best either. My son tried it and spat the whole thing on the floor and just said Ew and never wanted to try again 🥲 I guess I will have to go back to the bad for your teeth gummies

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I m happy with my choice, my kids love them

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I have tried numerous vitamins on my children but they are extremely fussy. This is the only vitamin that my 8 year old (who has autism) will actually take.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 20, 2015
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely awful. They do not taste like chocolate at all. What a waste of money. So disappointing! My little one really struggles with flavours and textures but chocolate is always a hit. He bit into one and nearly threw up! Such a good idea but so badly executed.
